::Prowl::

Prowl felt his mind choosing a target, although he couldn't see it 
directly. He knew that it was probably Iron Raptor's thoughts he was 
reading, but he didn't really care. He was acting on instinct. 
Prowl's mind had never felt anything like this before, and now the 
creature was in control, rage and instincts determining his actions.

Prowl replies to Iron Raptor with a roar, also beginning to toward 
Menasor. He got her thoughts, understanding them perfectly. Menasor 
was going to go down.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> * Breath rasped in her lungs, snorting to clear them of the scent 
of the ash 
> as her keen eye-sight penitrated the clouds that surrounded the 
field.
> Her head had snepped towards the direction of a roar seconds after 
hears her 
> left her throat, trying to see as far as she could and only 
mannaging to see 
> a...feathery outline?
> But her thoughts told her who it was.
> < Prowl....>
> * Her logicle mind controled this mode, but the wild sense was 
still there 
> and was eager to get into the fight.
> There was a slight flash of light in the ash before she heard a 
voice boom 
> over the clashes of metal against metal and yells of angry bots.
> She snarled/roared when a stray shot sent from Menasor landed a few 
feet 
> away from her, sending dirt flying towards her face.
> Growling she backed away and then began to move towards his 
position, 
> glancing towards Prowls direction as she moved.
> She'd decided on a target.
> Since she really didn't want to use speech right now she roared, 
waiting for 
> a reply from him.
> It was clear communications, explainign that a gustalt such as 
Menasor could 
> be taken by them IF they moved together and in one songle unit.
> It was time to get to work.*
> 
> 
>
